Ian Badcoe wrote:

>Hi,
>	I am developing a SLEAT TicTacToe screen saver, to use the space 
>cycles of the various machines I have available.
>
>	I was wondering whether anybody else would be interested in running it for me?
>  
>
Yeh sure. It might be easier if there was a plain EXE version since I 
tend to use Remote Connection to my workhorse PC and then 
logoff/disconnect leaving processes running with no display - and hence 
no screensaver. Also it has other (low CPU) jobs to do, so keeping the 
CPU priority low would be nice.

>	It's not as fully automatic as Seti@Home, in that you will need to 
>mail the results back to me (which will typically zip down to about 1/2 a meg).
>
>  
>
BTW 7-zip (www.7-zip.org) is a nice tool for zipping up files. I've seen 
it compress files to a quarter the size of an equivalent zip at max 
compression, so it might help alleviate the load on your mailbox.

Colin.
